page.title: 11PEREGRINE FALCONS
page.content: Across the Kiln road we have a pair of Peregrine Falcons who have three young.They have been watched 24 hours a day,the birds are due to fly next week,(23rd June-29th June 1985). Over in the Coedcaenewydd farm land there is a pair of buzzards.Last week we were walking there when the buzzard flew out of his nest and suddenly the Peregrine Falcon came from nowhere and attacked the buzzard then the buzzard flew away behind its tree. The Peregrine chicks were ringed almost three weeks ago when they were still quite young.The Peregrine Falcon is mainly a grey-blue colour with an orangey-yellow throat.Its usual speed is 280km/h on a dive or 200km/h while flying at its usual speed. Usualy the Peregrine Falcons like rocky cliffs by the sea,but ours has chosen an unusual place near the road.
